{"parentUuid":"48944acc-5180-4f52-a370-4688a1983266","isSidechain":false,"userType":"external","cwd":"/Volumes/M-Drive/Coding/VoiceOS","sessionId":"f7c429c5-e307-429a-8690-72f13eacd053","version":"2.0.58","gitBranch":"kmp/main","slug":"peppy-wandering-flask","message":{"model":"claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929","id":"msg_013yxgASqWzaD86Wwrt9Vm1M","type":"message","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_0179CfYMgzwGDj6SAM1KATio","name":"Write","input":{"file_path":"/Volumes/M-Drive/Coding/VoiceOS/docs/manuals/developer/features/manual-command-assignment-implementation-251203.md","content":"# Manual Command Assignment Implementation - Developer Manual\n\n**Feature:** Manual Command Assignment (VOS-META-001)\n**Version:** 1.0 (Phase 1 + Phase 2 Complete)\n**Platform:** Android (Room Database + Jetpack Compose)\n**Last Updated:** 2025-12-03\n**Commits:** 22bfcfe9 (Phase 1), ee9fb33f (Phase 2), 1cb5d94f (UI), 4e2b60ee (Tests)\n\n---\n\n## Table of Contents\n\n1. [Overview](#overview)\n2. [Architecture](#architecture)\n3. [Database Schema (Phase 1)](#database-schema-phase-1)\n4. [UI Implementation (Phase 2)](#ui-implementation-phase-2)\n5. [Speech Recognition Integration](#speech-recognition-integration)\n6. [Testing Strategy](#testing-strategy)\n7. [API Reference](#api-reference)\n8. [Performance Optimization](#performance-optimization)\n9. [Security Considerations](#security-considerations)\n10. [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)\n\n---\n\n## Overview\n\n### Purpose\n\nVOS-META-001 implements a comprehensive metadata quality feedback system that allows users to manually assign voice commands to UI elements that lack proper accessibility metadata. This addresses the critical gap where third-party apps with poor accessibility implementation result in \"learned but unusable\" elements.\n\n### Problem Solved\n\n**Before VOS-META-001:**\n- Elements without metadata get generic aliases (`button_1`, `framelayout_2`)\n- No voice commands generated (CommandGenerator returns empty list)\n- Users not notified about unusable elements\n- No mechanism to manually add voice commands\n\n**After VOS-META-001:**\n- Users see which elements lack voice commands (post-learning overlay)\n- Users can manually assign voice commands via speech\n- Commands saved as synonyms in database\n- Developer mode shows real-time element quality visualization\n\n### Implementation Phases\n\n**Phase 1 (Commit 22bfcfe9): Database Foundation**\n- Room database entities (ElementEntity, SynonymEntity)\n- DAOs with async operations\n- Database migration support\n- Element metadata quality scoring\n\n**Phase 2 (Commit ee9fb33f): UI & Speech Recognition**\n- Command Assignment Dialog (Jetpack Compose)\n- Speech recognition integration (SpeechRecognizer)\n- Voice recording and playback\n- Command synonym creation workflow\n\n**Testing (Commit 4e2b60ee): Comprehensive Unit Tests**\n- Database DAO tests\n- Entity validation tests\n- Repository pattern tests\n- Migration tests\n\n---\n\n## Architecture\n\n### High-Level Component Diagram\n\n```\n\n                  VoiceOS App Layer                      \n\n                                                         \n           \n   JIT Learning        Exploration Mode             \n   Service             Service                      \n           \n                                                       \n                               \n                                                        \n                                                        \n    \n     Command Assignment Controller                    \n     - Detects elements needing commands              \n     - Shows post-learning overlay                    \n     - Triggers assignment dialog                     \n    \n                                                        \n\n                          UI Layer (Compose)           \n                                                        \n    \n     CommandAssignmentDialog.kt                       \n     - Material3 Dialog UI                            \n     - Record button (3-second capture)               \n     - Playback controls                              \n     - Save/Cancel actions                            \n    \n                                                        \n\n                       Business Logic Layer            \n                                                        \n    \n     SpeechRecognitionManager.kt                      \n     - SpeechRecognizer integration                   \n     - Voice recording (16kHz, 16-bit mono)           \n     - Speech-to-text conversion                      \n     - Confidence scoring                             \n    \n                                                        \n                                                        \n    \n     MetadataQualityRepository.kt                     \n     - Business logic for quality scoring             \n     - Synonym creation and validation                \n     - Element metadata analysis                      \n    \n                                                        \n\n                        Data Layer (Room)              \n                                                        \n    \n     MetadataQualityDatabase.kt                       \n     - ElementDao                                     \n     - SynonymDao                                     \n     - Migration strategies                           \n     - Type converters                                \n    \n                                                        \n                                                        \n    \n     Room Entities                                    \n     - ElementEntity (element metadata + quality)     \n     - SynonymEntity (voice command synonyms)         \n    \n                                                         \n\n```\n\n### Data Flow\n\n```\nUser Learning Flow:\n\n1. User learns app (JIT or Exploration)\n2. ElementEntity records created for each UI element\n3. Quality score calculated (hasText, hasContentDescription, hasResourceId)\n4. Elements with quality < 40% flagged for manual assignment\n\nManual Assignment Flow:\n\n1. Post-learning overlay shows flagged elements\n2. User taps element  CommandAssignmentDialog opens\n3. User taps \"Record Command\"  SpeechRecognizer starts\n4. User speaks command (3-second window)\n5. Speech-to-text conversion  text result returned\n6. SynonymEntity created: elementUuid  spoken text\n7. Command saved to database\n8. Dialog shows success message\n\nVoice Command Execution Flow:\n\n1. User speaks command\n2. SpeechRecognizer converts to text\n3. SynonymDao.findElementByCommand(text) queries database\n4. ElementEntity UUID returned\n5. AccessibilityService activates element\n```\n\n---\n\n## Database Schema (Phase 1)\n\n### ElementEntity\n\n**Purpose:** Stores UI element metadata and quality metrics\n\n**File:** `modules/apps/VoiceOSCore/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/voiceoscore/database/entities/ElementEntity.kt`\n\n```kotlin\n@Entity(\n    tableName = \"elements\",\n    indices = [\n        Index(value = \"android.widget.Button\")\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"resource_id\")\n    val resourceId: String?,  // Android resource ID (optional)\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"text\")\n    val text: String?,  // \"timestamp_learned\")\n    val timestampLearned: Long,  // Epoch milliseconds\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"last_accessed\")\n    val lastAccessed: Long?,  // Last time element was used (optional)\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"access_count\")\n    val accessCount: Int = 0  // Number of times element was activated\n)\n```\n\n**Quality Score Calculation:**\n```kotlin\nfun calculateQualityScore(element: ElementEntity): Int {\n    var score = 0\n\n    // Text presence (40 points)\n    if (!element.text.isNullOrBlank()) score += 40\n\n    // ContentDescription presence (30 points)\n    if (!element.contentDescription.isNullOrBlank()) score += 30\n\n    // ResourceId presence (20 points)\n    if (!element.resourceId.isNullOrBlank()) score += 20\n\n    // ClassName specificity (10 points)\n    if (element.className.contains(\"Button\") ||\n        element.className.contains(\"EditText\") ||\n        element.className.contains(\"TextView\")) {\n        score += 10\n    }\n\n    return score.coerceIn(0, 100)\n}\n```\n\n**Thresholds:**\n- **0-39%**: Poor quality  Requires manual command assignment (RED)\n- **40-69%**: Moderate quality  May generate generic commands (YELLOW)\n- `modules/libraries/SpeechRecognition/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/speechrecognition/SpeechRecognitionManager.kt`\n\n```kotlin\nclass SpeechRecognitionManager(\n    private val context: Context\n) {\n    private var speechRecognizer: SpeechRecognizer? = null\n    private val recordingDuration = 3000L  // 3 seconds\n\n    fun startRecognition(\n        onResult: (String) -> Unit,\n        onError: (String) -> Unit\n    ) {\n        if (!SpeechRecognizer.isRecognitionAvailable(context)) {\n            onError(\"Speech recognition not available\")\n            return\n        }\n\n        speechRecognizer = SpeechRecognizer.createSpeechRecognizer(context).apply {\n            setRecognitionListener(object : RecognitionListener {\n                override fun onReadyForSpeech(params: Bundle?) {\n                    Log.d(\"SpeechRec\", \"Ready for speech\")\n                }\n\n                override fun onResults(results: Bundle?) {\n                    val matches = results?.getStringArrayList(\n                        SpeechRecognizer.RESULTS_RECOGNITION\n                    )\n                    val confidence = results?.getFloatArray(\n                        SpeechRecognizer.CONFIDENCE_SCORES\n                    )\n\n                    if (!matches.isNullOrEmpty()) {\n                        val bestMatch = matches[0]\n                        val bestConfidence = confidence?.get(0) ?: 0f\n\n                        if (bestConfidence > 0.7f) {\n                            onResult(bestMatch)\n                        } else {\n                            onError(\"Low confidence: $bestConfidence. Please try again.\")\n                        }\n                    } else {\n                        onError(\"No speech detected\")\n                    }\n\n                    destroy()\n                }\n\n                override fun onError(error: Int) {\n                    val errorMessage = when (error) {\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_AUDIO -> \"Audio recording error\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_CLIENT -> \"Client error\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS -> \"Missing permission\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_NETWORK -> \"Network error\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_NETWORK_TIMEOUT -> \"Network timeout\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_NO_MATCH -> \"No speech match\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_RECOGNIZER_BUSY -> \"Recognizer busy\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_SERVER -> \"Server error\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_SPEECH_TIMEOUT -> \"No speech input\"\n                        else -> \"Unknown error: $error\"\n                    }\n                    onError(errorMessage)\n                    destroy()\n                }\n\n                override fun onPartialResults(partialResults: Bundle?) {}\n                override fun onEvent(eventType: Int, params: Bundle?) {}\n                override fun onBeginningOfSpeech() {}\n                override fun onRmsChanged(rmsdB: Float) {}\n                override fun onBufferReceived(buffer: ByteArray?) {}\n                override fun onEndOfSpeech() {}\n            })\n        }\n\n        val intent = Intent(RecognizerIntent.ACTION_RECOGNIZE_SPEECH).apply {\n            putExtra(RecognizerIntent.EXTRA_LANGUAGE_MODEL, RecognizerIntent.LANGUAGE_MODEL_FREE_FORM)\n            putExtra(RecognizerIntent.EXTRA_LANGUAGE, Locale.getDefault())\n            putExtra(RecognizerIntent.EXTRA_MAX_RESULTS, 1)\n            putExtra(RecognizerIntent.EXTRA_SPEECH_INPUT_COMPLETE_SILENCE_LENGTH_MILLIS, recordingDuration)\n        }\n\n        speechRecognizer?.startListening(intent)\n\n        // Auto-stop after recording duration\n        Handler(Looper.getMainLooper()).postDelayed({\n            speechRecognizer?.stopListening()\n        }, recordingDuration)\n    }\n\n    fun destroy() {\n        speechRecognizer?.destroy()\n        speechRecognizer = null\n    }\n}\n```\n\n---\n\n## Testing Strategy\n\n### Unit Tests (Phase [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)\n\n---\n\n## Overview\n\n### Purpose\n\nVOS-META-001 implements a comprehensive metadata quality feedback system that allows users to manually assign voice commands to UI elements that lack proper accessibility metadata. This addresses the critical gap where third-party apps with poor accessibility implementation result in \"learned but unusable\" elements.\n\n### Problem Solved\n\n**Before VOS-META-001:**\n- Elements without metadata get generic aliases (`button_1`, `framelayout_2`)\n- No voice commands generated (CommandGenerator returns empty list)\n- Users not notified about unusable elements\n- No mechanism to manually add voice commands\n\n**After VOS-META-001:**\n- Users see which elements lack voice commands (post-learning overlay)\n- Users can manually assign voice commands via speech\n- Commands saved as synonyms in database\n- Developer mode shows real-time element quality visualization\n\n### Implementation Phases\n\n**Phase 1 (Commit 22bfcfe9): Database Foundation**\n- Room database entities (ElementEntity, SynonymEntity)\n- DAOs with async operations\n- Database migration support\n- Element metadata quality scoring\n\n**Phase 2 (Commit ee9fb33f): UI & Speech Recognition**\n- Command Assignment Dialog (Jetpack Compose)\n- Speech recognition integration (SpeechRecognizer)\n- Voice recording and playback\n- Command synonym creation workflow\n\n**Testing (Commit 4e2b60ee): Comprehensive Unit Tests**\n- Database DAO tests\n- Entity validation tests\n- Repository pattern tests\n- Migration tests\n\n---\n\n## Architecture\n\n### High-Level Component Diagram\n\n```\n\n                  VoiceOS App Layer                      \n\n                                                         \n           \n   JIT Learning        Exploration Mode             \n   Service             Service                      \n           \n                                                       \n                               \n                                                        \n                                                        \n    \n     Command Assignment Controller                    \n     - Detects elements needing commands              \n     - Shows post-learning overlay                    \n     - Triggers assignment dialog                     \n    \n                                                        \n\n                          UI Layer (Compose)           \n                                                        \n    \n     CommandAssignmentDialog.kt                       \n     - Material3 Dialog UI                            \n     - Record button (3-second capture)               \n     - Playback controls                              \n     - Save/Cancel actions                            \n    \n                                                        \n\n                       Business Logic Layer            \n                                                        \n    \n     SpeechRecognitionManager.kt                      \n     - SpeechRecognizer integration                   \n     - Voice recording (16kHz, 16-bit mono)           \n     - Speech-to-text conversion                      \n     - Confidence scoring                             \n    \n                                                        \n                                                        \n    \n     MetadataQualityRepository.kt                     \n     - Business logic for quality scoring             \n     - Synonym creation and validation                \n     - Element metadata analysis                      \n    \n                                                        \n\n                        Data Layer (Room)              \n                                                        \n    \n     MetadataQualityDatabase.kt                       \n     - ElementDao                                     \n     - SynonymDao                                     \n     - Migration strategies                           \n     - Type converters                                \n    \n                                                        \n                                                        \n    \n     Room Entities                                    \n     - ElementEntity (element metadata + quality)     \n     - SynonymEntity (voice command synonyms)         \n    \n                                                         \n\n```\n\n### Data Flow\n\n```\nUser Learning Flow:\n\n1. User learns app (JIT or Exploration)\n2. ElementEntity records created for each UI element\n3. Quality score calculated (hasText, hasContentDescription, hasResourceId)\n4. Elements with quality < 40% flagged for manual assignment\n\nManual Assignment Flow:\n\n1. Post-learning overlay shows flagged elements\n2. User taps element  CommandAssignmentDialog opens\n3. User taps \"Record Command\"  SpeechRecognizer starts\n4. User speaks command (3-second window)\n5. Speech-to-text conversion  text result returned\n6. SynonymEntity created: elementUuid  spoken text\n7. Command saved to database\n8. Dialog shows success message\n\nVoice Command Execution Flow:\n\n1. User speaks command\n2. SpeechRecognizer converts to text\n3. SynonymDao.findElementByCommand(text) queries database\n4. ElementEntity UUID returned\n5. AccessibilityService activates element\n```\n\n---\n\n## Database Schema (Phase 1)\n\n### ElementEntity\n\n**Purpose:** Stores UI element metadata and quality metrics\n\n**File:** `modules/apps/VoiceOSCore/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/voiceoscore/database/entities/ElementEntity.kt`\n\n```kotlin\n@Entity(\n    tableName = \"elements\",\n    indices = [\n        Index(value = [\"uuid\"], unique = true),\n        Index(value = [\"package_name\"]),\n        Index(value = [\"quality_score\"]),\n        Index(value = [\"timestamp_learned\"])\n    ]\n)\ndata class ElementEntity(\n    @PrimaryKey(autoGenerate = true)\n    val id: Long = 0,\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"uuid\")\n    val uuid: String,  // Unique identifier (SHA-256 hash)\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"package_name\")\n    val packageName: String,  // App package (e.g., \"com.example.app\")\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"class_name\")\n    val className: String,  // View class (e.g., \"android.widget.Button\")\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"resource_id\")\n    val resourceId: String?,  // Android resource ID (optional)\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"text\")\n    val text: String?,  // Element text content (optional)\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"content_description\")\n    val contentDescription: String?,  // Accessibility description (optional)\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"bounds\")\n    val bounds: String,  // \"x,y,width,height\" format\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"quality_score\")\n    val qualityScore: Int,  // 0-100 metadata quality score\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"timestamp_learned\")\n    val timestampLearned: Long,  // Epoch milliseconds\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"last_accessed\")\n    val lastAccessed: Long?,  // Last time element was used (optional)\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"access_count\")\n    val accessCount: Int = 0  // Number of times element was activated\n)\n```\n\n**Quality Score Calculation:**\n```kotlin\nfun calculateQualityScore(element: ElementEntity): Int {\n    var score = 0\n\n    // Text presence (40 points)\n    if (!element.text.isNullOrBlank()) score += 40\n\n    // ContentDescription presence (30 points)\n    if (!element.contentDescription.isNullOrBlank()) score += 30\n\n    // ResourceId presence (20 points)\n    if (!element.resourceId.isNullOrBlank()) score += 20\n\n    // ClassName specificity (10 points)\n    if (element.className.contains(\"Button\") ||\n        element.className.contains(\"EditText\") ||\n        element.className.contains(\"TextView\")) {\n        score += 10\n    }\n\n    return score.coerceIn(0, 100)\n}\n```\n\n**Thresholds:**\n- **0-39%**: Poor quality  Requires manual command assignment (RED)\n- **40-69%**: Moderate quality  May generate generic commands (YELLOW)\n- **70-100%**: Good quality  Generates accurate voice commands (GREEN)\n\n### SynonymEntity\n\n**Purpose:** Stores user-assigned voice command synonyms\n\n**File:** `modules/apps/VoiceOSCore/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/voiceoscore/database/entities/SynonymEntity.kt`\n\n```kotlin\n@Entity(\n    tableName = \"synonyms\",\n    indices = [\n        Index(value = ElementEntity.uuid\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"command_text\")\n    val commandText: String,  // Spoken command (e.g., \"submit form\")\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"confidence_score\")\n    val confidenceScore: Float,  // 0.0-1.0 speech recognition confidence\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"timestamp_created\")\n    val timestampCreated: Long,  // Epoch milliseconds\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"is_primary\")\n    val isPrimary: Boolean = false,  // True if this is the preferred command\n\n    @ColumnInfo(name = \"usage_count\")\n    val usageCount: Int = 0  // How many times this synonym was used\n)\n```\n\n### Database Class\n\n**File:** `modules/apps/VoiceOSCore/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/voiceoscore/database/MetadataQualityDatabase.kt`\n\n```kotlin\n@Database(\n    entities = `modules/libraries/SpeechRecognition/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/speechrecognition/SpeechRecognitionManager.kt`\n\n```kotlin\nclass SpeechRecognitionManager(\n    private val context: Context\n) {\n    private var speechRecognizer: SpeechRecognizer? = null\n    private val recordingDuration = 3000L  // 3 seconds\n\n    fun startRecognition(\n        onResult: (String) -> Unit,\n        onError: (String) -> Unit\n    ) {\n        if (!SpeechRecognizer.isRecognitionAvailable(context)) {\n            onError(\"Speech recognition not available\")\n            return\n        }\n\n        speechRecognizer = SpeechRecognizer.createSpeechRecognizer(context).apply {\n            setRecognitionListener(object : RecognitionListener {\n                override fun onReadyForSpeech(params: Bundle?) {\n                    Log.d(\"SpeechRec\", \"Ready for speech\")\n                }\n\n                override fun onResults(results: Bundle?) {\n                    val matches = results?.getStringArrayList(\n                        SpeechRecognizer.RESULTS_RECOGNITION\n                    )\n                    val confidence = results?.getFloatArray(\n                        SpeechRecognizer.CONFIDENCE_SCORES\n                    )\n\n                    if (!matches.isNullOrEmpty()) {\n                        val bestMatch = matches[0]\n                        val bestConfidence = confidence?.get(0) ?: 0f\n\n                        if (bestConfidence > 0.7f) {\n                            onResult(bestMatch)\n                        } else {\n                            onError(\"Low confidence: $bestConfidence. Please try again.\")\n                        }\n                    } else {\n                        onError(\"No speech detected\")\n                    }\n\n                    destroy()\n                }\n\n                override fun onError(error: Int) {\n                    val errorMessage = when (error) {\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_AUDIO -> \"Audio recording error\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_CLIENT -> \"Client error\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS -> \"Missing permission\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_NETWORK -> \"Network error\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_NETWORK_TIMEOUT -> \"Network timeout\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_NO_MATCH -> \"No speech match\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_RECOGNIZER_BUSY -> \"Recognizer busy\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_SERVER -> \"Server error\"\n                        SpeechRecognizer.ERROR_SPEECH_TIMEOUT -> \"No speech input\"\n                        else -> \"Unknown error: $error\"\n                    }\n                    onError(errorMessage)\n                    destroy()\n                }\n\n                override fun onPartialResults(partialResults: Bundle?) {}\n                override fun onEvent(eventType: Int, params: Bundle?) {}\n                override fun onBeginningOfSpeech() {}\n                override fun onRmsChanged(rmsdB: Float) {}\n                override fun onBufferReceived(buffer: ByteArray?) {}\n                override fun onEndOfSpeech() {}\n            })\n        }\n\n        val intent = Intent(RecognizerIntent.ACTION_RECOGNIZE_SPEECH).apply {\n            putExtra(RecognizerIntent.EXTRA_LANGUAGE_MODEL, RecognizerIntent.LANGUAGE_MODEL_FREE_FORM)\n            putExtra(RecognizerIntent.EXTRA_LANGUAGE, Locale.getDefault())\n            putExtra(RecognizerIntent.EXTRA_MAX_RESULTS, 1)\n            putExtra(RecognizerIntent.EXTRA_SPEECH_INPUT_COMPLETE_SILENCE_LENGTH_MILLIS, recordingDuration)\n        }\n\n        speechRecognizer?.startListening(intent)\n\n        // Auto-stop after recording duration\n        Handler(Looper.getMainLooper()).postDelayed({\n            speechRecognizer?.stopListening()\n        }, recordingDuration)\n    }\n\n    fun destroy() {\n        speechRecognizer?.destroy()\n        speechRecognizer = null\n    }\n}\n```\n\n---\n\n## Testing Strategy\n\n### Unit Tests (Phase No index on quality_score\n@Query(\"SELECT * FROM elements WHERE quality_score < 40\")\n\n//  FAST - Uses quality_score index\n@Query(\"SELECT * FROM elements WHERE quality_score < 40 AND package_name = :pkg\")\n```\n\n### Caching Strategy\n\n```kotlin\nclass MetadataQualityRepository {\n    private val poorQualityCache = LruCache<String, List<ElementEntity>>(10)\n\n    suspend fun getPoorQualityElements(packageName: String): List<ElementEntity> {\n        // Check cache first\n        poorQualityCache.get(packageName)?.let { return it }\n\n        // Query database\n        val elements = elementDao.getPoorQualityElements(packageName)\n\n        // Cache result\n        poorQualityCache.put(packageName, elements)\n\n        return elements\n    }\n}\n```\n\n---\n\n## Security Considerations\n\n### Voice Recording Privacy\n\n```kotlin\n// Store recordings locally only\nprivate val voiceRecordingsDir = File(context.filesDir, \"voice_recordings\")\n    .apply { if (!exists()) mkdirs() }\n\n// Encrypt recordings at rest\nval encryptedFile = EncryptedFile.Builder(\n    context,\n    File(voiceRecordingsDir, \"$uuid.enc\"),\n    masterKey,\n    EncryptedFile.FileEncryptionScheme.AES256_GCM_HKDF_4KB\n).build()\n```\n\n### Database Encryption\n\n```kotlin\nval database = Room.databaseBuilder(context, MetadataQualityDatabase::class.java, \"metadata.db\")\n    .openHelperFactory(SupportFactory(SQLiteDatabase.getBytes(\"passphrase\".toCharArray())))\n    .build()\n```\n\n---\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\n### Issue: Speech recognition fails\n\n**Symptoms:**\n- ERROR_NO_MATCH errors\n- Low confidence scores\n- \"No speech detected\" messages\n\n**Solutions:**\n```kotlin\n// 1. Check microphone permission\nif (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context, Manifest.permission.RECORD_AUDIO)\n    != PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) {\n    requestPermissions(arrayOf(Manifest.permission.RECORD_AUDIO), REQUEST_CODE)\n}\n\n// 2. # Feature branches\nbugfix/*      # Bug fixes\nhotfix/*      # Emergency fixes\nrelease/*     # Release preparation\n```\n\n#### Commit Message Format\n```\n<type>(<scope>): ranging tests\n```\n\n---\n\n## Module Development\n\n### Creating a New Module\n\n1. **Module Structure**\n```bash\nlibraries/NewModule/\n src/\n    main/\n       java/com/augmentalis/newmodule/\n id(\"com.android.library\")\n    id(\"org.jetbrains.kotlin.android\")\n    id(\"kotlin-kapt\")\n}\n\nandroid {\n    namespace = \"com.augmentalis.newmodule\"\n    compileSdk = 34\n    \n {\n            isMinifyEnabled = true\n            proguardFiles(\n                getDefaultProguardFile(\"proguard-android-optimize.txt\"),\n                \"proguard-rules.pro\"\n            )\n        }\n    }\n    \n    compileOptions {\n        sourceCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_17\n        targetCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_17\n    }\n    \n    kotlinOptions {\n        jvmTarget = \"17\"\n    }\n}\n\ndependencies {\n    // Core dependencies\n    implementation(\"androidx.core:core-ktx:1.12.0\")\n    implementation(\"org.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-coroutines-android:1.7.3\")\n    \n    // Testing\n    testImplementation(\"junit:junit:4.13.2\")\n    androidTestImplementation(\"androidx.test.ext:junit:1.1.5\")\n}\n```\n\n3. **Register Module**\n```kotlin\n// settings.gradle.kts\ninclude(\":libraries:NewModule\")\n```\n\n### Zero-Overhead Implementation Pattern\n\n#### Direct Access Pattern\n```kotlin\n//  Don't: Wrapper pattern\nclass DeviceWrapper {\n    private val device = getDevice()\n    fun getInfo(): Info = device.getInfo()\n}\n\n//  Do: Direct access\ninline fun getDeviceInfo(): DeviceInfo = Build.MODEL\n```\n\n#### State Management\n```kotlin\nclass ModuleManager {\n    // Use StateFlow for reactive state\n    private val _state = MutableStateFlow(ModuleState())\n    val state: StateFlow<ModuleState> = _state.asStateFlow()\n    \n    // Update state efficiently\n    fun updateState(update: ModuleState.() -> ModuleState) {\n        _state.update { it.update() }\n    }\n}\n```\n\n#### Memory Management\n```kotlin\n// Object pooling for frequent allocations\nobject BufferPool {\n    private val pool = LinkedList<ByteBuffer>()\n    \n    fun acquire(size: Int): ByteBuffer {\n        return pool.poll()?.clear() ?: ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(size)\n    }\n    \n    fun release(buffer: ByteBuffer) {\n        if (pool.size < MAX_POOL_SIZE) {\n            pool.offer(buffer)\n        }\n    }\n}\n```\n\n### AIDL Service Implementation\n\n1. **Define AIDL Interface**\n```aidl\n// IModuleService.aidl\npackage com.augmentalis.module;\n\ninterface IModuleService {\n    void startOperation(in Bundle config);\n    void stopOperation();\n    String getStatus();\n    void registerCallback(IModuleCallback callback);\n}\n```\n\n2. **Implement Service**\n```kotlin\nclass ModuleService : Service() {\n    private val binder = object : Implementation\n        }\n        \n        override fun getStatus(): String {\n            return currentStatus\n        }\n        \n        override fun registerCallback(callback: IModuleCallback) {\n            callbacks.register(callback)\n        }\n    }\n    \n    override fun onBind(intent: Intent): IBinder = binder\n}\n```\n\n3. **Client Connection**\n```kotlin\nclass ModuleClient(private val context: Context) {\n    private var service: IModuleService? = null\n    \n    private val connection = object : ServiceConnection {\n        override fun onServiceConnected(name: ComponentName, binder: IBinder) {\n            service = IModuleService.Stub.asInterface(binder)\n        }\n        \n        override fun onServiceDisconnected(name: ComponentName) {\n            service = null\n        }\n    }\n    \n    fun connect() {\n        val intent = Intent().apply {\n            component = ComponentName(\n                \"com.augmentalis.module\",\n                \"com.augmentalis.module.ModuleService\"\n            )\n        }\n        context.bindService(intent, connection, Context.BIND_AUTO_CREATE)\n    }\n}\n```\n\n---\n\n## Kotlin Coding Standards\n\n### Null Safety Patterns\n\n**CRITICAL:** Never use force unwrap (`!!`) in production code. Use these safe patterns instead:\n\n#### Pattern 1: Local Value Capture (Cache Access)\n```kotlin\n//  WRONG - Unsafe\nif (cachedValue != null) {\n    return cachedValue!!\n}\n\n//  CORRECT - Safe\nval cached = cachedValue\nif (cached != null) {\n    return cached\n}\n```\n\n#### Pattern 2: Elvis with Early Return\n```kotlin\n//  WRONG - Unsafe\nval result = field!!\nprocessResult(result)\n\n//  CORRECT - Safe\nval result = field ?: return\nprocessResult(result)\n\n//  CORRECT - With logging\nval result = field ?: run {\n    Log.w(TAG, \"Field is null\")\n    return\n}\n```\n\n#### Pattern 3: Elvis with Also (Lazy Init)\n```kotlin\n//  WRONG - Unsafe\nif (_service == null) {\n    _service = createService()\n}\nreturn _service!!\n\n//  CORRECT - Safe\nreturn _service ?: createService().also { _service = it }\n```\n\n#### Pattern 4: requireNotNull with Return Value\n```kotlin\n//  WRONG - Discards return\nrequireNotNull(field) { \"Field required\" }\ndoSomething(field!!)\n\n//  CORRECT - Captures return\nval value = requireNotNull(field) { \"Field required\" }\ndoSomething(value)\n```\n\n#### Pattern 5: Result Unwrapping\n```kotlin\n//  WRONG - Unsafe after isFailure check\nif (result.isFailure) {\n    return Result.failure(result.exceptionOrNull()!!)\n}\n\n//  CORRECT - Use getOrThrow\nif (result.isFailure) {\n    return Result.failure(result.exceptionOrNull() ?: Exception(\"Unknown error\"))\n}\n\n//  BETTER - Use getOrThrow directly\nval value = result.getOrThrow()\n```\n\n#### Pattern 6: Self-Referential Runnables\n```kotlin\n//  WRONG - Uses !! in self-reference\nrunnable = Runnable {\n    doWork()\n    handler.postDelayed(runnable!!, DELAY)\n}\nhandler.post(runnable!!)\n\n//  CORRECT - Object with 'this' reference\nval runnable = object : Runnable {\n    override fun run() {\n        doWork()\n        handler.postDelayed(this, DELAY)\n    }\n}\nthis.runnable = runnable\nhandler.post(runnable)\n```\n\n### Map and Collection Access\n\n```kotlin\n//  WRONG - Unsafe map access\nval value = map[key]!!\n\n//  CORRECT - With elvis\nval value = map[key] ?: defaultValue\n\n//  CORRECT - With containsKey check + capture\nval value = map[key]\nif (value != null) {\n    processValue(value)\n}\n```\n\n### Compose UI Patterns\n\n```kotlin\n//  WRONG - Using !! in Compose\nif (stats != null) {\n    Text(text = stats!!.count.toString())\n}\n\n//  CORRECT - Local capture for smart cast\nval s = stats\nif (s != null) {\n    Text(text = s.count.toString())\n}\n\n//  CORRECT - With let\nstats?.let { s ->\n    Text(text = s.count.toString())\n}\n```\n\n---\n\n## Testing Guidelines\n\n### Unit Testing\n\n#### Test Detection\n```kotlin\nclass MemoryLeakDetector {\n    fun detectLeaks() {\n        if (BuildConfig.DEBUG) {\n            // Use LeakCanary\n            LeakCanary.config = LeakCanary.config.copy(\n                dumpHeap = true,\n                retainedVisibleThreshold = 3\n            )\n        }\n    }\n}\n```\n\n#### Memory Profiling\n```kotlin\n// Track allocations\nclass AllocationTracker {\n    private val allocations = mutableMapOf<String, Int>()\n    \n    inline fun <T> track(tag: String, block: () -> T): T {\n        val before = Runtime.getRuntime().totalMemory()\n        val result = block()\n        val after = Runtime.getRuntime().totalMemory()\n        \n        allocations[tag] = (after - before).toInt()\n        return result\n    }\n}\n```\n\n### CPU Optimization\n\n#### Profiling\n```kotlin\n@OptIn(ExperimentalTime::class)\ninline fun <T> measureTimeMillis(block: () -> T): Pair<T, Long> {\n    val start = System.currentTimeMillis()\n    val result = block()\n    val duration = System.currentTimeMillis() - start\n    return result to duration\n}\n\n// Usage\nval (result, time) = measureTimeMillis {\n    processVoiceCommand(command)\n}\nLog.d(\"Performance\", \"Command processed in ${time}ms\")\n```\n\n#### Thread Management\n```kotlin\nobject ThreadPools {\n    val IO = }\n    \n    fun batchNetworkRequests() {\n        WorkManager.getInstance(context)\n            .enqueueUniquePeriodicWork(\n                \"sync\",\n }\n}\n```\n\n---\n\n## Debugging Guide\n\n### Logging Strategy\n\n```kotlin\nobject Logger {\n    private const val TAG = \"VOS4\"\n    \n    inline fun d(message: () -> String) {\n        if Issues\n\n**Issue**: `ClassNotFoundException`\n```proguard\n# Solution: Add to ProGuard rules\n-keep class com.augmentalis.** { *; }\n```\n\n**Issue**: AIDL service not binding\n```kotlin\n// android:name=\"com.augmentalis.action.BIND\" />\n    </intent-filter>\n</service>\n```\n\n#### Performance Issues\n\n**Issue**: Slow app startup\n```kotlin\n// Solution: Lazy initialization\nclass App initializeHeavyComponents()\n        }\n    }\n}\n```\n\n**Issue**: Memory leaks\n```kotlin\n// Solution: Use weak references\nclass MyCallback(activity: Activity) {\n    private val activityRef = {"parentUuid":"8b1867ee-d521-484c-9489-f40727939913","isSidechain":false,"userType":"external","cwd":"/Volumes/M-Drive/Coding/VoiceOS","sessionId":"f7c429c5-e307-429a-8690-72f13eacd053","version":"2.0.58","gitBranch":"kmp/main","slug":"peppy-wandering-flask","type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"# /analyze - Universal Analysis Command\n\n## Usage\n`/analyze [target] [modifiers]`\n\n## Arguments\n| Arg | Required | Description |\n|-----|----------|-------------|\n| target | No | File, folder, module, or screenshot path (auto-detected) |\n\n## Modifiers\n| Type | Options |\n|------|---------|\n| Analysis | `.code` `.ui` `.workflow` `.docs` |\n| Reasoning | `.cot` `.tot` |\n| Behavior | `.swarm` `.yolo` `.stop` |\n| Debug | `.debug` |\n\n### Scope Modifiers\n\n| Modifier | Focus | Use Case |\n|----------|-------|----------|\n| `.code` | Code quality analysis | 7-layer framework, SOLID, performance |\n| `.ui` | UI/UX analysis | Layout, components, accessibility via Vision |\n| `.docs` | Documentation analysis | Coverage, accuracy, examples, freshness |\n| `.debug` | Detailed debug logging | Verbose output, intermediate steps, reasoning traces |\n\n## Auto-Detection\n| Input | Type |\n|-------|------|\n| `.kt`, `.java`, `.ts`, `.py`, `.go`, `.rs`, `.swift` | CODE |\n| `.png`, `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.webp`, `.gif` | UI |\n| `.md` with spec/plan/tasks | WORKFLOW |\n| `.md` other | DOCS |\n| Directory | CODE (scan all) |\n\n---\n\n## Domain Specialist (MANDATORY)\n\n**Spawn specialist before analysis.**\n\n| Domain | Specialist | Level |\n|--------|------------|-------|\n| Memory, performance | Systems | OS-Level |\n| Threading, concurrency | Concurrency | OS-Level |\n| Platform internals | Platform | OS-Level |\n| Security, auth, crypto | Security | PhD-Level |\n| Algorithm complexity | Algorithm | PhD-Level |\n| API, network | Network | Senior |\n| Database, queries | Data | Senior |\n| UI components | UI | Senior |\n\n---\n\n## CoT/ToT Analysis (MANDATORY)\n\n| Method | When | Approach |\n|--------|------|----------|\n| **CoT** | Linear flow | Step-by-step reasoning |\n| **ToT** | Complex/branching | Multi-hypothesis exploration |\n\n**Required Output:**\n```\nANALYSIS:\n- Files read: [list]\n- Call flow: A  B  C\n- Impact scope: [components]\n- Findings: [issues]\n- Method: CoT | ToT\n```\n\n---\n\n## .code - Code Analysis\n\n### 7-Layer Framework\n| Layer | Focus | Priority |\n|-------|-------|----------|\n| 1 | Functional Correctness | P0 |\n| 2 | Static Analysis (syntax, types, unused) | P0 |\n| 3 | Runtime Analysis (memory, null, bounds) | P0 |\n| 4 | Dependency Analysis (circular, missing) | P1 |\n| 5 | Error Handling (try/catch, propagation) | P1 |\n| 6 | Architecture (SOLID, patterns, coupling) | P2 |\n| 7 | Performance (complexity, bottlenecks) | P2 |\n\n### Output Format\n```\nCODE ANALYSIS: {target}\n Functional: [PASS/FAIL] - {issues}\n Static: [PASS/FAIL] - {issues}\n Runtime: [PASS/FAIL] - {issues}\n Dependencies: [PASS/FAIL] - {circular deps}\n Error Handling: [PASS/FAIL] - {gaps}\n Architecture: [score/10] - {violations}\n Performance: [score/10] - {bottlenecks}\n\nCRITICAL: {count} | HIGH: {count} | MEDIUM: {count}\n```\n\n---\n\n## .ui - UI Analysis (Vision)\n\n### Steps\n| Step | Action |\n|------|--------|\n| 1 | Load screenshot via Claude Vision |\n| 2 | Extract layout structure (hierarchy, grid) |\n| 3 | Identify components (buttons, inputs, cards) |\n| 4 | Analyze styling (colors, spacing, typography) |\n| 5 | Check accessibility (contrast, touch targets) |\n| 6 | Suggest improvements |\n| 7 | Generate code (optional) |\n\n### Analysis Types\n| Type | Focus |\n|------|-------|\n| `layout` | Structure, hierarchy, spacing |\n| `components` | Component identification, patterns |\n| `accessibility` | WCAG compliance, contrast, targets |\n| `full` | All of the above |\n\n### Output Format\n```\nUI ANALYSIS: {screenshot}\n Layout: {grid/flex}, {hierarchy depth}\n Components: {count} identified\n Colors: {palette extracted}\n Accessibility: [PASS/WARN/FAIL]\n Suggestions: {improvements}\n```\n\n---\n\n## .workflow - Workflow Analysis\n\nAnalyzes spec/plan/tasks for:\n| Check | Description |\n|-------|-------------|\n| Completeness | All phases defined? |\n| Consistency | No contradictions? |\n| Dependencies | Correct ordering? |\n| Gaps | Missing requirements? |\n\n---\n\n## .docs - Documentation Analysis\n\n| Check | Description |\n|-------|-------------|\n| Coverage | All public APIs documented? |\n| Accuracy | Docs match implementation? |\n| Examples | Working code examples? |\n| Freshness | Last updated date? |\n\n---\n\n## Intelligence Chaining\n\nPost-analysis auto-detection:\n\n| Finding | Trigger | Suggestion |\n|---------|---------|------------|\n| Critical bugs | >0 found | `/fix .yolo` |\n| High debt | >70 score | `/refactor` |\n| Low docs | <50% coverage | `/document` |\n| Low tests | <90% coverage | `/implement .test` |\n\n---\n\n## Examples\n| Command | Behavior |\n|---------|----------|\n| `/analyze src/Auth.kt` | Auto-detect CODE, 7-layer analysis |\n| `/analyze .ui screenshot.png` | Vision analysis, component extraction |\n| `/analyze .code src/` | Focus on code quality, 7-layer framework |\n| `/analyze .ui .app` | UI analysis for current app |\n| `/analyze .docs` | Analyze documentation coverage and accuracy |\n| `/analyze .debug .swarm` | Multi-agent with verbose debug logging |\n| `/analyze .code .cot src/` | Code analysis with CoT reasoning |\n| `/analyze .workflow spec.md` | Spec completeness check |\n| `/analyze .swarm src/` | Multi-agent analysis |\n\n---\n\n## Quality Gates\n| Metric | Target |\n|--------|--------|\n| P0 issues | 0 |\n| P1 issues | 3 |\n| Architecture score | 7/10 |\n| Test coverage | 90% |\n\n## Related\n`/fix`, `/refactor`, `/review`, `/document`\n"}]},"isMeta":true,"uuid":"64a16f49-8d95-4148-8f38-e828cd3408a8","timestamp":"2025-12-04T05:21:44.263Z"}

/analyze - Universal Analysis Command\n\n## Usage\n`/analyze [target] [modifiers]`\n\n## Arguments\n| Arg | Required | Description |\n|-----|----------|-------------|\n| target | No | File, folder, module, or screenshot path (auto-detected) |\n\n## Modifiers\n| Type | Options |\n|------|---------|\n| Analysis | `.code` `.ui` `.workflow` `.docs` |\n| Reasoning | `.cot` `.tot` |\n| Behavior | `.swarm` `.yolo` `.stop` |\n| Debug | `.debug` |\n\n### Scope Modifiers\n\n| Modifier | Focus | Use Case |\n|----------|-------|----------|\n| `.code` | Code quality analysis | 7-layer framework, SOLID, performance |\n| `.ui` | UI/UX analysis | Layout, components, accessibility via Vision |\n| `.docs` | Documentation analysis | Coverage, accuracy, examples, freshness |\n| `.debug` | Detailed debug logging | Verbose output, intermediate steps, reasoning traces |\n\n## Auto-Detection\n| Input | Type |\n|-------|------|\n| `.kt`, `.java`, `.ts`, `.py`, `.go`, `.rs`, `.swift` | CODE |\n| `.png`, `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.webp`, `.gif` | UI |\n| `.md` with spec/plan/tasks | WORKFLOW |\n| `.md` other | DOCS |\n| Directory | CODE (scan all) |\n\n---\n\n## Domain Specialist (MANDATORY)\n\n**Spawn specialist before analysis.**\n\n| Domain | Specialist | Level |\n|--------|------------|-------|\n| Memory, performance | Systems | OS-Level |\n| Threading, concurrency | Linear flow | Step-by-step reasoning |\n| **ToT** | Complex/branching | Multi-hypothesis exploration |\n\n**Required Output:**\n```\nANALYSIS:\n- Files read: [list]\n- Call flow: A  B  C\n- Impact scope: [components]\n- Findings: [issues]\n- Method: CoT | ToT\n```\n\n---\n\n## .code - Code Analysis\n\n### 7-Layer Framework\n| Layer | Focus | Priority |\n|-------|-------|----------|\n| 1 | Functional Correctness | P0 |\n| 2 | Static Analysis (syntax, types, unused) | P0 |\n| 3 | Runtime Analysis (memory, null, bounds) | P0 |\n| 4 | Dependency Analysis (circular, missing) | P1 |\n| 5 | Error Handling (try/catch, propagation) | P1 |\n| 6 | Architecture (SOLID, patterns, coupling) | P2 |\n| 7 | Performance (complexity, bottlenecks) | P2 |\n\n### Output Format\n```\nCODE ANALYSIS: {target}\n Functional: [PASS/FAIL] - {issues}\n Static: [PASS/FAIL] - {issues}\n Runtime: [PASS/FAIL] - {issues}\n Dependencies: [PASS/FAIL] - {circular deps}\n Error Handling: [PASS/FAIL] - {gaps}\n Architecture: [score/10] - {violations}\n Performance: [score/10] - {bottlenecks}\n\nCRITICAL: {count} | HIGH: {count} | MEDIUM: {count}\n```\n\n---\n\n## .ui - UI Analysis (Vision)\n\n### Steps\n| Step | Action |\n|------|--------|\n| 1 | Load screenshot via Claude Vision |\n| 2 | Extract layout structure (hierarchy, grid) |\n| 3 | Identify components (buttons, inputs, cards) |\n| 4 | Analyze styling (colors, spacing, typography) |\n| 5 | Check accessibility (contrast, touch targets) |\n| 6 | Suggest improvements |\n| 7 | Generate code (optional) |\n\n### Analysis Types\n| Type | Focus |\n|------|-------|\n| `layout` | Structure, hierarchy, spacing |\n| `components` | Component identification, patterns |\n| `accessibility` | WCAG compliance, contrast, targets |\n| `full` | All of the above |\n\n### Output Format\n```\nUI ANALYSIS: {screenshot}\n Layout: {grid/flex}, {hierarchy depth}\n Components: {count} identified\n Colors: {palette extracted}\n Accessibility: Load spec from `docs/ideacode/specs/###-feature/spec.md`\n2. Extract platforms (Android, iOS, Web, Backend)\n3. Order phases: Backend  Shared/KMP  Android  iOS  Web\n4. Calculate KMP benefits (if Android+iOS)\n5. Assess swarm activation (3+ platforms OR 15+ tasks)\n6. Generate time estimates (sequential vs parallel)\n7. Write plan to `plan.md`\n8. Offer chaining: `/tasks` or `/implement`\n\n## Platform Phase Ordering\n| Priority | Phase | Rationale |\n|----------|-------|-----------|\n| 1 | Backend | Foundation (API, DB) |\n| 2 | Shared/KMP | only | No KMP |\n| iOS only | No KMP |\n| Android + iOS | KMP setup (Phase 1) |\n| Benefit > 40% code reuse | Recommend KMP |\n| Benefit < 40% | Optional KMP |\n\n## Swarm Assessment\nRecommends swarm if:\n- 3+ platforms, OR\n- Estimated 15+ tasks, OR\n- Complex integration points\n\n## Examples\n| Command | Result |\n|---------|--------|\n| `/plan spec.md` | Plan  offer `/tasks` |\n| `/plan spec.md --tasks` | Plan  auto-generate task breakdown |\n| `/plan spec.md --yolo` | Plan  tasks  implement  test  commit |\n| `/plan spec.md --yolo --tasks` | Full workflow with explicit task generation |\n| `/plan spec.md --cot` | Show phase ordering reasoning |\n\n## Output Format\n```markdown\n# Implementation Plan: {Feature}\n\n## Overview\nPlatforms: {Android, iOS, Web, Backend}\nSwarm Recommended: {Yes/No}\nEstimated: {N} tasks, {M} hours\n\n## Phases\n### Phase 1: {Backend}\n- Task 1: ...\n- Task 2: ...\n\n### Phase 2: {KMP Setup} (if applicable)\n- Task 1: Implementation Plan: LearnApp Performance Optimization\n\n**Feature ID:** VOS-PERF-001\n**Created:** 2025-12-03\n**Status:** Draft\n**Priority:** P0 (Critical - Blocking Production)\n**Platforms:** Android (VoiceOS Core, LearnApp, UUIDCreator)\n**Estimated Effort:** 12-16 hours (6-8 hours with swarm)\n\n---\n\n## Executive Summary\n\nFix critical performance issues in LearnApp causing:\n- 1351ms element capture latency (vs. 50ms target = **27x slower**)\n- 30-50% click failure rate (vs. 95% target)\n- Memory leak in long-running accessibility service\n\n**Root Causes Identified:**\n1. **P0:** Synchronous database I/O during alias deduplication (315 DB ops per screen)\n2. **P0:** Stale AccessibilityNodeInfo references after registration delay\n3. **P1:** Uncanceled coroutine scopes leaking memory\n\n**Expected Improvement:**\n- Performance: 1351ms  <50ms (**27x faster**)\n- Click success: 50-70%  95%+ (**40% more elements**)\n- Memory: Stable (no growing heap)\n\n---\n\n## Platform Assessment\n\n| Platform | Affected | Complexity | Priority |\n|----------|----------|------------|----------|\n| **Android (VoiceOSCore)** |  ExplorationEngine | High | P0 |\n| **Android (UUIDCreator)** |  UuidAliasManager | High | P0 |\n| **Android (Database)** |  Room DAO | Medium | P0 |\n| iOS |  Not affected | N/A | N/A |\n| Web |  Not affected | N/A | N/A |\n| Backend |  Not affected | N/A | N/A |\n\n**Platform Decision:** Android-only optimization (no KMP needed)\n\n---\n\n## Swarm Assessment\n\n**Swarm Recommended:**  YES\n\n**Criteria Met:**\n- [x] 15+ distinct tasks (18 tasks total)\n- [x] Multiple independent workstreams (Database, ExplorationEngine, Testing)\n- [x] Critical deadline (blocking production use on RealWear)\n- [x] Parallel execution possible (3 workstreams)\n\n**Swarm Configuration:**\n- **Workstream 1:** Database Batch Operations (P0-1)\n- **Workstream 2:** Click-Before-Register Refactor (P0-2)\n- **Workstream 3:** Memory Leak Fixes (P1)\n- **Workstream 4:** Testing & Validation (Parallel)\n\n**Time Savings:**\n- Sequential: 16 hours\n- Parallel (Swarm): 8 hours\n- **Savings: 8 hours (50%)**\n\n---\n\n## Phase Breakdown\n\n### **Phase 1: P0 Fixes - Database Batch Operations** (6 hours  3 hours with swarm)\n\n**Objective:** Reduce 315 DB operations per screen to 2 operations (157x speedup)\n\n**Dependencies:** None (can start immediately)\n\n**Tasks:**\n\n#### 1.1 Add Batch Insert Interface (30 min)\n**File:** `/modules/libraries/UUIDCreator/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/uuidcreator/repository/IUUIDRepository.kt`\n\n**Changes:**\n```kotlin\ninterface IUUIDRepository {\n    // Existing methods...\n\n    /**\n     * Batch insert aliases in single transaction\n     * @param aliases List of alias DTOs to insert\n     */\n    @Insert(onConflict = OnConflictStrategy.REPLACE)\n    suspend fun insertAliasesBatch(aliases: List<UUIDAliasDTO>)\n\n    /**\n     * Get all aliases for deduplication check\n     * @return List of all existing aliases\n     */\n    @Query(\"SELECT * FROM uuid_aliases\")\n    suspend fun getAllAliases(): List<UUIDAliasDTO>\n}\n```\n\n**Testing:**\n- Unit test: Verify batch insert inserts all aliases\n- Unit test: Verify `getAllAliases()` returns complete set\n\n---\n\n#### 1.2 Implement Batch Insert in Room DAO (30 min)\n**File:** `/modules/libraries/UUIDCreator/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/uuidcreator/repository/UuidRepository.kt`\n\n**Changes:**\n```kotlin\n@Dao\ninterface UuidAliasDao {\n    @Insert(onConflict = OnConflictStrategy.REPLACE)\n    suspend fun insertAliasesBatch(aliases: List<UUIDAliasDTO>)\n\n    @Query(\"SELECT * FROM uuid_aliases\")\n    suspend fun getAllAliases(): List<UUIDAliasDTO>\n}\n\nclass UuidRepository(private val dao: UuidAliasDao) : IUUIDRepository {\n    override suspend fun insertAliasesBatch(aliases: List<UUIDAliasDTO>) {\n        dao.insertAliasesBatch(aliases)\n    }\n\n    override suspend fun getAllAliases(): List<UUIDAliasDTO> {\n        return dao.getAllAliases()\n    }\n}\n```\n\n**Testing:**\n- Integration test: Insert 100 aliases, verify all persisted\n- Performance test: Measure batch insert vs. individual inserts\n\n---\n\n#### 1.3 Implement Batch Deduplication Algorithm (2 hours)\n**File:** `/modules/libraries/UUIDCreator/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/uuidcreator/alias/UuidAliasManager.kt`\n\n**Changes:**\n```kotlin\n/**\n * Batch set aliases with deduplication (in-memory)\n *\n * Performance: O(N) instead of O(N)\n * Database ops: 2 (1 query + 1 batch insert) instead of 315\n *\n * @param uuidAliasMap Map of UUID to base alias\n * @return Map of UUID to deduplicated alias\n */\nsuspend fun setAliasesBatch(uuidAliasMap: Map<String, String>): Map<String, String> {\n    return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {\n        // Step 1: Load existing aliases ONCE\n        val existingAliases = uuidRepository.getAllAliases()\n        val existingAliasSet = existingAliases.map { it.alias }.toSet()\n\n        // Step 2: In-memory deduplication\n        val deduplicatedAliases = mutableMapOf<String, String>()\n        val aliasCounts = mutableMapOf<String, Int>()\n\n        for ((uuid, baseAlias) in uuidAliasMap) {\n            var candidateAlias = baseAlias\n            var suffix = aliasCounts.getOrDefault(baseAlias, 1)\n\n            // Check against existing DB aliases AND current batch\n            while (existingAliasSet.contains(candidateAlias) ||\n                   deduplicatedAliases.values.contains(candidateAlias)) {\n                candidateAlias = \"$baseAlias-$suffix\"\n                suffix++\n            }\n\n            aliasCounts[baseAlias] = suffix\n            deduplicatedAliases[uuid] = candidateAlias\n        }\n\n        // Step 3: Batch insert all aliases\n        val aliasDTOs = deduplicatedAliases.map { (uuid, alias) ->\n            UUIDAliasDTO(\n                id = 0,\n                alias = alias,\n                uuid = uuid,\n                isPrimary = true,\n                createdAt = System.currentTimeMillis()\n            )\n        }\n\n        uuidRepository.insertAliasesBatch(aliasDTOs)\n\n        deduplicatedAliases\n    }\n}\n```\n\n**Testing:**\n- Unit test: 63 elements with 20 duplicates  correct suffix numbering\n- Unit test: Verify no DB queries in deduplication loop\n- Performance test: 63 elements completes in <100ms\n\n---\n\n#### 1.4 Refactor registerElements() to Use Batch API (1 hour)\n**File:** `/modules/apps/VoiceOSCore/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/voiceoscore/learnapp/exploration/ExplorationEngine.kt`\n\n**Changes:**\n```kotlin\n/**\n * Register elements with batch deduplication\n *\n * Before: 315 DB operations for 63 elements (1351ms)\n * After: 2 DB operations (8ms)\n *\n * @param elements List of elements to register\n * @param packageName Target app package\n * @return List of UUIDs\n */\nprivate suspend fun registerElements(\n    elements: List<ElementInfo>,\n    packageName: String\n): List<String> {\n    // Step 1: Generate UUIDs (fast, no DB)\n    val uuidElementMap = mutableMapOf<String, ElementInfo>()\n\n    for (element in elements) {\n        val uuid = thirdPartyGenerator.generateUuid(element.node, packageName)\n\n        val uuidElement = UUIDElement(\n            uuid = uuid,\n            className = element.className,\n            resourceId = element.resourceId,\n            text = element.text,\n            contentDescription = element.contentDescription,\n            isClickable = element.isClickable,\n            isEditable = element.isEditable,\n            metadata = UUIDMetadata(\n                packageName = packageName,\n                timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis()\n            ),\n            accessibility = UUIDAccessibility(\n                isFocusable = element.isFocusable ?: false,\n                isImportantForAccessibility = true\n            )\n        )\n\n        uuidCreator.registerElement(uuidElement)\n        uuidElementMap[uuid] = element\n        element.uuid = uuid\n    }\n\n    // Step 2: Generate base aliases (in parallel)\n    val uuidAliasMap = uuidElementMap.mapValues { (_, element) ->\n        generateAliasFromElement(element)\n    }\n\n    // Step 3: Batch deduplicate and insert (2 DB ops total)\n    val startTime = System.currentTimeMillis()\n    val deduplicatedAliases = aliasManager.setAliasesBatch(uuidAliasMap)\n    val elapsed = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime\n\n    // Log performance metrics\n    android.util.Log.d(\"ExplorationEngine-Perf\",\n        \"Registered ${elements.size} elements in ${elapsed}ms (${elements.size * 1000 / elapsed} elements/sec)\")\n\n    // Step 4: Log only actual deduplications (reduce noise)\n    deduplicatedAliases.forEach { (uuid, alias) ->\n        val baseAlias = uuidAliasMap[uuid]\n        if (alias != baseAlias) {\n            android.util.Log.v(\"ExplorationEngine\",\n                \"Deduplicated: '$baseAlias'  '$alias'\")\n        }\n    }\n\n    return uuidElementMap.keys.toList()\n}\n```\n\n**Testing:**\n- Integration test: 63-element screen registers in <100ms\n- Integration test: Aliases deduplicated correctly\n- Regression test: Existing alias logic still works\n\n---\n\n#### 1.5 Performance Testing & Validation (2 hours)\n**Tests:**\n\n```kotlin\n@RunWith(AndroidJUnit4::class)\nclass BatchDeduplicationPerformanceTest {\n\n    @Test\n    fun `batch deduplication should complete in under 100ms for 63 elements`() {\n        val uuidAliasMap = (1..63).associate {\n            \"uuid-$it\" to \"button\"  // All same base alias (worst case)\n        }\n\n        val startTime = System.currentTimeMillis()\n        val result = aliasManager.setAliasesBatch(uuidAliasMap)\n        val elapsed = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime\n\n        assertThat(elapsed).isLessThan(100)\n        assertThat(result.size).isEqualTo(63)\n        assertThat(result.values.distinct().size).isEqualTo(63)  // All unique\n    }\n\n    @Test\n    fun `batch deduplication should make only 2 database calls`() {\n        val dbCallCounter = DatabaseCallCounter()\n        val uuidAliasMap = (1..63).associate { \"uuid-$it\" to \"button\" }\n\n        aliasManager.setAliasesBatch(uuidAliasMap)\n\n        assertThat(dbCallCounter.queryCount).isEqualTo(1)  // getAllAliases\n        assertThat(dbCallCounter.insertCount).isEqualTo(1)  // insertAliasesBatch\n        assertThat(dbCallCounter.totalCalls).isEqualTo(2)\n    }\n\n    @Test\n    fun `registerElements should complete in under 100ms for 63 elements`() {\n        val elements = List(63) { createMockElement() }\n\n        val startTime = System.currentTimeMillis()\n        val uuids = engine.registerElements(elements, \"com.test\")\n        val elapsed = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime\n\n        assertThat(elapsed).isLessThan(100)  // Was 1351ms before fix\n        assertThat(uuids).hasSize(63)\n    }\n}\n```\n\n---\n\n### **Phase 2: P0 Fixes - Click-Before-Register Refactor** (4 hours  2 hours with swarm)\n\n**Objective:** Fix 30-50% click failure rate by clicking elements while nodes are fresh\n\n**Dependencies:** None (can run parallel with Phase 1)\n\n**Tasks:**\n\n#### 2.1 Analyze Current Click Flow (30 min)\n**File:** Review `/modules/apps/VoiceOSCore/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/voiceoscore/learnapp/exploration/ExplorationEngine.kt` lines 541-650\n\n**Understand:**\n- Current registration-then-click flow\n- Screen transition handling\n- Navigation graph building\n- Element click tracking\n\n**Deliverable:** Architecture diagram showing current vs. proposed flow\n\n---\n\n#### 2.2 Refactor exploreScreenRecursive() (2 hours)\n**File:** `/modules/apps/VoiceOSCore/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/voiceoscore/learnapp/exploration/ExplorationEngine.kt`\n\n**Changes:**\n```kotlin\n/**\n * Explore screen recursively using DFS\n *\n * CRITICAL FIX: Click elements BEFORE registration to avoid stale node references\n *\n * Flow:\n * 1. Explore screen (collect elements)\n * 2. CLICK elements (while nodes fresh)  MOVED HERE\n * 3. Register elements (nodes can be stale now, we don't need them)\n * 4. Build navigation graph\n */\nprivate suspend fun exploreScreenRecursive(\n    packageName: String,\n    currentDepth: Int,\n    parentScreenHash: String?\n) {\n    // ... screen detection logic ...\n\n    when (val explorationResult = screenExplorer.exploreScreen(rootNode, packageName)) {\n        is ScreenExplorationResult.Success -> {\n            val screenState = explorationResult.screenState\n            val screenHash = screenState.hash\n\n            // Mark as visited\n            screenStateManager.markAsVisited(screenHash)\n\n            // Order elements by strategy (DFS)\n            val orderedElements = strategy.orderElements(explorationResult.safeClickableElements)\n\n            // PRE-REGISTRATION: Store UUIDs temporarily for navigation graph\n            val tempUuidMap = mutableMapOf<ElementInfo, String>()\n            for (element in explorationResult.allElements) {\n                val uuid = thirdPartyGenerator.generateUuid(element.node, packageName)\n                element.uuid = uuid\n                tempUuidMap[element] = uuid\n            }\n\n            // \n            // CRITICAL: CLICK LOOP (nodes still fresh)\n            // \n            for (element in orderedElements) {\n                // Skip if strategy says no\n                if (!strategy.shouldExplore(element)) {\n                    android.util.Log.d(\"ExplorationEngine-Skip\",\n                        \"Skipping element (strategy): ${element.text ?: element.contentDescription}\")\n                    continue\n                }\n\n                // Get UUID from temp map\n                val elementUuid = tempUuidMap[element] ?: continue\n\n                // Check if already clicked\n                if (clickTracker.isElementClicked(screenHash, elementUuid)) {\n                    android.util.Log.v(\"ExplorationEngine\",\n                        \"Element already clicked: $elementUuid\")\n                    continue\n                }\n\n                // CLICK ELEMENT (node is fresh here)\n                val elementDesc = element.text ?: element.contentDescription ?: \"\"\n                val elementType = element.className.substringAfterLast('.')\n\n                android.util.Log.d(\"ExplorationEngine-Visual\",\n                    \">>> CLICKING ELEMENT: \\\"$elementDesc\\\" ($elementType)\")\n\n                val clicked = clickElement(element.node)  //  Works because node is fresh!\n\n                if (!clicked) {\n                    android.util.Log.w(\"ExplorationEngine-Skip\",\n                        \"CLICK FAILED: \\\"$elementDesc\\\" ($elementType) - UUID: $elementUuid\")\n                    continue  // Try next element\n                }\n\n                // Mark as clicked\n                clickTracker.markElementClicked(screenHash, elementUuid)\n\n                // Wait for screen transition\n                delay(SCREEN_TRANSITION_DELAY)\n\n                // Detect new screen\n                val newRootNode = accessibilityService.rootInActiveWindow\n                if (newRootNode == null) {\n                    android.util.Log.w(\"ExplorationEngine\", \"No root node after click\")\n                    continue\n                }\n\n                val newScreenHash = screenStateManager.getScreenHash(newRootNode)\n\n                // Handle navigation\n                if (newScreenHash != screenHash) {\n                    // New screen detected\n                    android.util.Log.d(\"ExplorationEngine\",\n                        \"Exploring new screen: $newScreenHash (from element: $elementDesc)\")\n\n                    // Recurse into new screen\n                    exploreScreenRecursive(packageName, currentDepth + 1, screenHash)\n\n                    // Navigate back\n                    navigateBack()\n                    delay(SCREEN_TRANSITION_DELAY)\n                } else {\n                    // Same screen (e.g., expandable control)\n                    android.util.Log.v(\"ExplorationEngine\",\n                        \"Same screen after click (expandable control?)\")\n                }\n\n                // Nullify node reference (prevent memory leak)\n                if (android.os.Build.VERSION.SDK_INT < android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES.UPSIDE_DOWN_CAKE) {\n                    @Suppress(\"DEPRECATION\")\n                    element.node?.recycle()\n                }\n                element.node = null\n            }\n\n            // \n            // POST-CLICKING: Register elements (don't need nodes anymore)\n            // \n            val elementUuids = registerElements(explorationResult.allElements, packageName)\n\n            // Build navigation graph\n            navigationGraphBuilder.addScreen(screenState, elementUuids)\n\n            // Add edges from parent\n            if (parentScreenHash != null) {\n                navigationGraphBuilder.addEdge(parentScreenHash, screenHash)\n            }\n        }\n\n        // ... error handling `/modules/libraries/UUIDCreator/src/main/java/com/augmentalis/uuidcreator/alias/UuidAliasManager.kt`\n\n**Changes:**\n```kotlin\n/**\n * Batch set aliases with deduplication (in-memory)\n *\n * Performance: O(N) instead of O(N)\n * Database ops: 2 (1 query + 1 batch insert) instead of 315\n *\n * @param uuidAliasMap Map of UUID to base alias\n * @return Map of UUID to deduplicated alias\n */\nsuspend fun setAliasesBatch(uuidAliasMap: Map<String, String>): Map<String, String> {\n    return withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {\n        // Step 1: Load existing aliases ONCE\n        val existingAliases = uuidRepository.getAllAliases()\n        val existingAliasSet = existingAliases.map { it.alias }.toSet()\n\n        // Step 2: In-memory deduplication\n        val deduplicatedAliases = mutableMapOf<String, String>()\n        val aliasCounts = mutableMapOf<String, Int>()\n\n        for ((uuid, baseAlias) in uuidAliasMap) {\n            var candidateAlias = baseAlias\n            var suffix = aliasCounts.getOrDefault(baseAlias, 1)\n\n            // Check against existing DB aliases AND current batch\n            while (existingAliasSet.contains(candidateAlias) ||\n                   deduplicatedAliases.values.contains(candidateAlias)) {\n                candidateAlias = \"$baseAlias-$suffix\"\n                suffix++\n            }\n\n            aliasCounts[baseAlias] = suffix\n            deduplicatedAliases[uuid] = candidateAlias\n        }\n\n        // Step 3: Batch insert all aliases\n        val aliasDTOs = deduplicatedAliases.map { (uuid, alias) ->\n            UUIDAliasDTO(\n                id = 0,\n                alias = alias,\n                uuid = uuid,\n                isPrimary = true,\n                createdAt = System.currentTimeMillis()\n            )\n        }\n\n        uuidRepository.insertAliasesBatch(aliasDTOs)\n\n        deduplicatedAliases\n    }\n}\n```\n\n**Testing:**\n- Unit test: 63 elements with 20 duplicates  correct suffix DB)\n    val uuidElementMap = mutableMapOf<String, ElementInfo>()\n\n    for (element in elements) {\n        val uuid = thirdPartyGenerator.generateUuid(element.node, packageName)\n\n        val uuidElement = UUIDElement(\n            uuid = uuid,\n            className = element.className,\n            resourceId = element.resourceId,\n            text = element.text,\n            contentDescription = element.contentDescription,\n            isClickable = element.isClickable,\n            isEditable = element.isEditable,\n            metadata = UUIDMetadata(\n                packageName = packageName,\n                timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis()\n            ),\n            accessibility = UUIDAccessibility(\n                isFocusable = element.isFocusable ?: false,\n                isImportantForAccessibility = true\n            )\n        )\n\n        uuidCreator.registerElement(uuidElement)\n        uuidElementMap[uuid] = element\n        element.uuid = uuid\n    }\n\n    // Step 2: Generate base aliases (in parallel)\n    val uuidAliasMap = uuidElementMap.mapValues { (_, element) ->\n        generateAliasFromElement(element)\n    }\n\n    // Step 3: Batch deduplicate and insert (2 DB ops total)\n    val startTime = System.currentTimeMillis()\n    val deduplicatedAliases = aliasManager.setAliasesBatch(uuidAliasMap)\n    val elapsed = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime\n\n    // Log performance metrics\n    android.util.Log.d(\"ExplorationEngine-Perf\",\n        \"Registered ${elements.size} elements in ${elapsed}ms (${elements.size * 1000 / elapsed} elements/sec)\")\n\n    // Step 4: Log only actual deduplications (reduce noise)\n    deduplicatedAliases.forEach { (uuid, alias) ->\n        val baseAlias = uuidAliasMap[uuid]\n        if (alias != baseAlias) {\n            android.util.Log.v(\"ExplorationEngine\",\n                \"Deduplicated: '$baseAlias'  '$alias'\")\n        }\n    }\n\n    return uuidElementMap.keys.toList()\n}\n```\n\n**Testing:**\n- Integration test: 63-element screen registers in <100ms\n- Integration test: Aliases deduplicated correctly\n- Regression test: Existing alias {"parentUuid":"98ee765e-65a1-4619-b093-ff6af631ae8e","isSidechain":false,"userType":"external","cwd":"/Volumes/M-Drive/Coding/VoiceOS","sessionId":"f7c429c5-e307-429a-8690-72f13eacd053","version":"2.0.58","gitBranch":"kmp/main","slug":"peppy-wandering-flask","type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"# /plan - Create Implementation Plan\n\n## Usage\n`/plan <spec_file> [flags]`\n\n## Arguments\n| Arg | Required | Description |\n|-----|----------|-------------|\n| spec_file | Yes | Path to specification file |\n\n## Flags\n| Flag | Effect |\n|------|--------|\n| `--yolo` | Auto-chain to tasksimplementtestcommit |\n| `--tasks` | Generate detailed task list from plan |\n| `--stop` | Disable chaining |\n| `--cot` | Show reasoning (phase ordering, KMP logic) |\n| `--tot` | Tree of Thought (explore approaches) |\n\n## Process\n1. Load spec from `docs/ideacode/specs/###-feature/spec.md`\n2. Extract platforms (Android, iOS, Web, Backend)\n3. Order phases: Backend  Shared/KMP  Android  iOS  Web\n4. Calculate KMP benefits (if Android+iOS)\n5. Assess swarm activation (3+ platforms OR 15+ tasks)\n6. Generate time estimates (sequential vs parallel)\n7. Write plan to `plan.md`\n8. Offer chaining: `/tasks` or `/implement`\n\n## Platform Phase Ordering\n| Priority | Phase | Rationale |\n|----------|-------|-----------|\n| 1 | Backend | Foundation (API, DB) |\n| 2 | Shared/KMP | Code reuse (if Android+iOS) |\n| 3 | Android | Most users |\n| 4 | iOS | Depends on shared |\n| 5 | Web | UI layer |\n\n## KMP Decision Logic\n| Condition | Action |\n|-----------|--------|\n| Android only | No KMP |\n| iOS only | No KMP |\n| Android + iOS | KMP setup (Phase 1) |\n| Benefit > 40% code reuse | Recommend KMP |\n| Benefit < 40% | Optional KMP |\n\n## Swarm Assessment\nRecommends swarm if:\n- 3+ platforms, OR\n- Estimated 15+ tasks, OR\n- Complex integration points\n\n## Examples\n| Command | Result |\n|---------|--------|\n| `/plan spec.md` | Plan  offer `/tasks` |\n| `/plan spec.md --tasks` | Plan  auto-generate task breakdown |\n| `/plan spec.md --yolo` | Plan  tasks  implement  test  commit |\n| `/plan spec.md --yolo --tasks` | Full workflow with explicit task generation |\n| `/plan spec.md --cot` | Show phase ordering reasoning |\n\n## Output Format\n```markdown\n# Implementation Plan: {Feature}\n\n## Overview\nPlatforms: {Android, iOS, Web, Backend}\nSwarm Recommended: {Yes/No}\nEstimated: {N} tasks, {M} hours\n\n## Phases\n### Phase 1: {Backend}\n- Task 1: ...\n- Task 2: ...\n\n### Phase 2: {KMP Setup} (if applicable)\n- Task 1: ...\n\n## Time Estimates\nSequential: {X} hours\nParallel (Swarm): {Y} hours\nSavings: {X-Y} hours ({percentage}%)\n```\n\n## MCP Integration\nUses: `ideacode_plan`\n\n## Related Commands\n| Command | Purpose |\n|---------|---------|\n| `/specify` | Create spec first |\n| `/tasks` | Generate tasks from plan |\n| `/implement` | Execute implementation |\n| `/develop` | Full workflow (includes plan) |\n\n## Documentation\n- Spec: `docs/ideacode/specs/006-intelligent-tech-stack-workflow/spec.md`\n\n## Metadata\n- **Command:** `/plan`\n- **Version:** 9.0\n- **Platform-Aware:** Load spec from `docs/ideacode/specs/###-feature/spec.md`\n2. Extract platforms (Android, iOS, Web, Backend)\n3. Order phases: Backend  Shared/KMP  Android  iOS  Web\n4. Calculate KMP benefits (if Android+iOS)\n5. Assess swarm activation (3+ platforms OR 15+ tasks)\n6. Generate time estimates (sequential vs parallel)\n7. Write plan to `plan.md`\n8. only | No KMP |\n| iOS only | No KMP |\n| Android + iOS | KMP setup (Phase 1) |\n| Benefit > 40% code reuse | Recommend KMP |\n| Benefit < 40% | Optional KMP |\n\n## Swarm Assessment\nRecommends swarm if:\n- 3+ platforms, OR\n- Estimated 15+ tasks, OR\n- Complex integration points\n\n## Examples\n| Command | Result |\n|---------|--------|\n| `/plan spec.md` | Plan  offer `/tasks` |\n| `/plan generation |\n| `/plan spec.md --cot` | Show phase ordering reasoning |\n\n## Output Format\n```markdown\n# Implementation Plan: {Feature}\n\n## Overview\nPlatforms: {Android, iOS, Web,
